definition: to narrow one's eyes and gaze at something with great attention

sentences.english: His practical rationale was that this would offer him wider career opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 當時，他這個現實的考慮是著眼於更廣闊的就業前景。

sentences.english: Many of the documents filed were aimed at keeping the organization functioning.
sentences.chinese: 聲請的文件多半是著眼於讓這個組織繼續運作。

sentences.english: Love looks with telescope; envy with microscope.
sentences.chinese: 愛情大處著眼，忌妒吹毛求疵。
